Question
========

It is assumed that the correlation between two tests X and Y that both measure intelligence is 0.80. In a random sample of n = 50 individuals, one finds R~XY~ = 0.71. Based on this result, the null hypothesis ρ~XY~ = 0.80 can be rejected in favor of the alternative hypothesis ρ~XY~ \< 0.80 at

Answerlist
----------

* Α = 0.01
* Α = 0.05 but not at α = 0.01
* Α = 0.10 but not at α = 0.05

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* Α = 0.01: Incorrect
* Α = 0.05 but not at α = 0.01: Incorrect
* Α = 0.10 but not at α = 0.05: Correct
